Question 3 on the ballot will give them one.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

In just a few weeks, high school students in Manchester are bringing Question 3 to the voters: whether or not a student from each high school can have a seat on the school committee as a non-voting member.

Started by Young Organizers United and the Granite State Organizing Project, the success of Question 3 is crucial to have a student member than can voice concerns, opinions and help shape the very policies that will affect them.

Young Organizers United is also hosting a candidate forum Tuesday, October 22 from 6 to 7:30 p.m. at Central High School in Manchester. The forum will ask local candidates questions that are important to students. Any questions about the event can be emailed to the youth at Granite State Organizing Project.

The election is taking place on November 5, find your polling location.

Sincerely,

Devon Chaffee
Executive Director, ACLU of New Hampshire
